data.text:
Asia Justice Coalition member Legal Action Worldwide (LAW) has published a five-video series to understand the ongoing #internationaljustice and #accountability mechanisms concerning the #Rohingya. These videos provide simplified information on the ongoing cases before different international courts and how the Rohingya can participate in these processes. The videos are available in the #Rohingyalanguage. Watch the videos below! https://lnkd.in/g32g-Qgc

On 4-5 July, the Asia Justice Coalition secretariat hosted its Third Women in International Justice and Accountability (#WIJA) Board Meeting in Bangkok, Thailand. #WIJAWednesday Co-Impact The two-day meeting focused on updates on programmatic activities in #Bangladesh and #SriLanka and on discussions about the structure, scope, and vision of the WIJA project. The meeting provided great insights into the future direction of the project as well. We thank the Board members who attended the meetings in person. The Board members pressed the need to highlight and bridge the #gender and #geographic gap in #Asian leadership in the international legal ecosystem. Our Board comprises 12 leaders who are subject experts in or adjacent to #internationallaw from the region. The Board geographically covers Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Myanmar, India, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Nepal. To learn more, check here: https://lnkd.in/g22veHvi To follow our #WIJA work, kindly check out our website here: https://lnkd.in/dQDXGM8U Women's Education and Research Centre Centre for Peace and Justice, BRAC University Coalition for the International Criminal Court Global Action Against Mass Atrocity Crimes (GAAMAC) The Hague Humanity Hub
